description: Possibly from French triomphe (“triumph”) or Old French triumphe. If so, it is a doublet of triumph and thriambus. Compare German Trumpf.

entries.meaning: (card games) The suit, in a game of cards, that outranks all others.
(card games) A playing card of that suit.
examples: He played an even higher trump.

entries.meaning: (figuratively) Something that gives one an advantage, especially one held in reserve.
(colloquial, now rare) An excellent person; a fine fellow, a good egg.
examples: Alfred is a trump, I think you say.

entries.meaning: An old card game, almost identical to whist; the game of ruff.
examples: There be many one that breaketh this carde, […] and playeth there with oftentimes at the blinde trompe, wherby they be no winners but great losers

entries.meaning: A card of the major arcana of the tarot.

verbs.description: trump (third-person singular simple present trumps, present participle trumping, simple past and past participle trumped)

entries.meaning: (transitive, card games) To play on (a card of another suit) with a trump.
examples: He knew the hand was lost when his ace was trumped.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, card games) To play a trump, or to take a trick with a trump.
(transitive) To get the better of, or finesse, a competitor.
(transitive, dated) To impose unfairly; to palm off.
examples: Authors have been trumped upon us.
In this election, it would seem issues of national security trumped economic issues.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To outweigh; be stronger, greater, bigger than or in other way superior to.

description: From Middle English trumpe, trompe (“trumpet”) from Old French trompe (“horn, trump, trumpet”), from Frankish *trumpa, *trumba (“trumpet”), from a common Germanic word of imitative origin.
Akin to Old High German trumpa, trumba (“horn, trumpet”), Middle Dutch tromme (“drum”), Middle Low German trumme (“drum”). More at trumpet, drum.

examples: Sound, sound the trump of fame,

entries.meaning: The noise made by an elephant through its trunk.

verbs.description: trump (third-person singular simple present trumps, present participle trumping, simple past and past participle trumped)

examples: And without warning me, as he lay there, he suddenly trumped next to me in bed.

description: Shortening of Jew's-trump, which may be from French jeu-trump, jeu tromp, jeu trompe (a trump, or toy, to play with).
